data.title: Starlight Archives

Calling all Starlight Theatre fans—we need your help! The Pitch’s annual “Best of KC,” a contest in which Kansas Citians cast their votes for the most loved people, tastes, sounds, sights and businesses from all around the city, recently began accepting nominations. This will be the biggest year yet with more than 370 categories to choose … Continued

On this week’s episode, Heartbreak Hotel prepares to rock-and-roll in Chicago, Moulin Rouge! is brought to life on stage, young stars shine at the 2018 Jimmy Awards and Head Over Heels “Go-Go’s” to Broadway! 'Million Dollar Quartet' prequel 'Heartbreak Hotel' makes Chicago debut Heartbreak Hotel, a new musical that follows the story of Elvis Presley’s rise to fame, begins its run … Continued

Since 1951, Starlight Theatre has strived to serve as one of Kansas City’s finest performance venues for audiences of all ages. We’re honored that voters in KC Parent’s Family Favorite competition resoundingly agree! Starlight was recently lauded as one of the KC Parent’s “Favorite Live Show” attractions in the publication’s 2018 Family Favorite awards. A previous winner of … Continued

On this week’s episode, Bandstand swings into movie theaters, the 2018 Tony winners are announced, Half Time hip-hops onto the Paper Mill stage and Mayor Sly James hosts a read-aloud at Starlight! Bandstand Swinging to the Big Screen The original Broadway production of Bandstand will screen in movie theaters nationwide June 25 and 28, including at numerous locations in the Kansas … Continued

Kansas City Mayor Sly James is known for his bow ties – and for his love of all things Kansas City, including Starlight Theatre! Mark your calendars for Saturday night, June 30 because just prior to that evening’s performance of Rodgers + Hammerstein’s Cinderella, Mayor Sly will read aloud from the new children’s book “Mayor Sly … Continued

On this week’s episode, Tina: The Tina Turner Musical makes its world premiere in London, Starlight’s Blue Star award winners shine bright, Spamalot is headed to the big screen, and Turner Classic Movies is MAD About Musicals! Tina Turner Musical Opens in West End at Aldwych Theatre Tina: The Musical opened at London’s Aldwych Theatre on … Continued

Have you been searching for a comprehensive source for news stories about Starlight and Broadway theatre? Look no further than Starlight’s new web series: Broadway Beat. On each episode, Starlight’s staff will bring you the latest stories from the theatre world—from news right here at Starlight in Kansas City, all the way to the bright lights … Continued

On this week’s episode, the new musical Jagged Little Pill debuts at the American Repertory Theatre, Starlight's horticulture team steals the show, new details emerge on the royal Diana musical and On Your Feet! opens our Broadway season under the stars. You, You, You Oughta Know: Alanis Morissette’s 'Jagged Little Pill' Is Now A Musical

On this week’s episode of Talkin’ With Taylor, Taylor sits down with President and CEO of Starlight Theatre, Rich Baker, to discuss the upcoming Tony® Awards, the role Rich plays in the Awards, and how the Tony’s affect the shows that he books for the Starlight stage. Held annually since 1947, the Tony Awards celebrates … Continued

On this week’s episode, a sponge that lives in a pineapple tops the Tony Nominations, Idina Menzel goes undercover, Starlight honors the best in high school musicals in the Kansas City area and Summer works hard for the money on the Today Show. 2018 Tony Award Nominations: SpongeBob SquarePants and Mean Girls Lead the Pack

Some exciting updates are happening here at Starlight Theatre! Patron’s safety is our number one priority, so we’ve incorporated non-invasive magnetometers as an additional security measure. Now, when patrons enter the venue, they will walk through the magnetometers before being shown to their seat. With this additional screening, we recommend allowing a little extra time … Continued

Earlier this spring, current board members had an opportunity to mingle with former board members at Starlight’s Board Annual Reunion. In its fourth year, the Board Reunion recognizes and celebrates the dedication of Starlight’s board members, both past and present. The evening included a short program with remarks from John Murphy, Chair of the Starlight … Continued

On this week’s Broadway Beat, Broadway finds its Cher, Crazy Ex-Girlfriend may be coming to an end, Starlight transports event guests to 1907 Coney Island and the ghost with the most is heading to Broadway. Stephanie J. Block Will Play Cher in the Upcoming Cher Show The new Broadway-bound bio-musical The Cher Show has found its star! Two-time Tony nominee Stephanie … Continued

Single-show tickets to Starlight Theatre’s Broadway and concert events are on sale now – and online ticket scalpers are lurking. To enjoy your Starlight experience this summer without unnecessary hassles or strains on your wallet, we offer advice to avoid getting burned by third-party online ticket sellers. How can you get great seats without breaking … Continued

Starlight Theatre was recognized among leading companies and individuals for exemplary support of the arts in Kansas City at the 14th Annual ArtsKC Awards Luncheon on Feb. 23. Nominated for the 2017 ArtsKC Fund Excellence Award, Starlight was in good company as a finalist alongside Bank of Blue Valley and Lathrop & Gage. While the … Continued

Seeing a live concert under the stars at Starlight Theatre is a memorable experience. Apparently visitors to the Kansas City area wholeheartedly agree! Starlight was recently celebrated in VisitKC’s Visitors’ Choice Awards competition, bringing home top honors as voters’ “Favorite Concert/Live Music Venue.” VisitKC’s 2017 voting campaign, limited to people who live outside the five-county … Continued

‘Tis the season to find the perfect gift for all those ‘special someones’ on your list. Rather than buying a tie that’s the wrong color, a sweater that doesn’t fit or the newest techie gadget that they’ll never figure out, we suggest giving the gift of live entertainment! Starlight Theatre offers several gift options to … Continued

Kudos to several members of the Starlight Theatre Board of Directors who have recently been honored for their personal and organizational accomplishments: Anita Gorman Starlight Board Lifetime Member Anita Gorman recently received The Honorable Cornelius Amory Pugsley Medal from the American Academy for Park and Recreation Administration. Pugsley Medals are the most prestigious awards that … Continued

It’s been said that a picture paints a thousand words. If that’s true, then the artists who spent two days painting 28 portraits of Starlight Theatre in mid-September generated 28,000 words! Starlight’s landscaping was in full bloom and the weather was ideal when about 20 Kansas City area artists set up their easels and canvases … Continued

If you’re attending the Plaza Art Fair on Sept. 22-24, we invite you to stop by Starlight Theatre’s booth (#15) to learn more about our upcoming shows and education programs. You just might win a prize, too! Starlight is pleased to be part of the Experience ArtsKC section of the fair for the first time … Continued

When guests enter Starlight Theatre through Gate 7, alongside the east ticket office, they can visit a thoughtful display: Starlight’s Window into the Work. During the past two summers, Starlight’s Education Department has created window displays centered on themes from each Broadway show with input from Spotlight Stage performers, community ticket groups, full-time staff and … Continued

One of Starlight Theatre’s own, Donna Thomason, recently received well-deserved honors for her longtime service to the City Union Mission. Thomason, who serves as president and creative director of EPIC Innovative Events, a Starlight subsidiary company, was one of three Kansas City women honored at the City Union Mission’s 10th Annual “Women Who’ve Changed the … Continued

Ever been burned by a third-party online ticket purchase? It hurts! Not only can you lose money by paying inflated prices, but, in some cases, you may buy counterfeit tickets and end up missing the Broadway musical or concert you really wanted to see. So, how do you get the seats you want without breaking … Continued

Eleven new members, representing a broad cross-section of leading Kansas City businesses, have joined the Starlight Theatre Board of Directors. Working closely with 20+ existing board members, Starlight President and CEO Rich Baker and Starlight officers, the new directors will provide governance and guidance to our nonprofit theatre during their three-year terms. The new directors … Continued

The passion and commitment to the arts that Ben Rauth and Khalil Odum demonstrated during their years as Starlight STARS of Tomorrow was evident in March in legislatures at the state and national levels. The two friends, both seniors at Kansas City’s Paseo Academy of Fine and Performing Arts, won the chance to represent Missouri … Continued

The Board of Directors of Starlight Theatre voices its support for Kansas City, Missouri’s three infrastructure bond proposals, which are scheduled to go before voters on April 4. The Board believes the case for passage of these questions is strong and represents a financially sound approach to deal with the City’s significant infrastructure needs, including roads, … Continued

Starlight Indoors has lots to love! The musical comedy First Date is fun for friends and lovers through Feb. 26, and the not-so-prim princesses of Disenchanted! will steal hearts March 7-19. Audiences are applauding and doubling over with laughter at First Date, the musical comedy currently on stage at Starlight Indoors. The ideal show for couples celebrating Valentine’s month or … Continued

Guests who attended Sister’s Christmas Catechism at Starlight Indoors in December cleaned out their storage closets and helped a good cause by bringing non-working and unused holiday lights to Starlight Theatre to be recycled. Starlight participated for the first time in a holiday lights recycling program sponsored by Southeast Enterprises, a Kansas City nonprofit sheltered workshop. For … Continued

John Murphy, a seasoned member of the Starlight Theatre Board of Directors and immediate past chairman of Kansas City law firm Shook, Hardy & Bacon, has begun his two-year term as chairman of the Starlight board. As he undertakes this top leadership role with Kansas City’s oldest and largest performing arts organization, Murphy took time … Continued
